org.gridgain.grid.lang
Class GridMetadataAwareAdapter

java.lang.Object
  org.gridgain.grid.lang.GridMetadataAwareAdapter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, GridMetadataAware
Direct Known Subclasses:
GridEventAdapter, GridJavaLogger, GridJbossLogger, GridJclLogger, GridJobWrapper, GridLambdaAdapter, GridLog4jLogger, GridSlf4jLogger, GridSpringBean, GridTaskAdapter, GridTomcatLogger, GridTuple, GridTuple2, GridTuple3, GridTuple4, GridTuple5, GridTupleV
public class GridMetadataAwareAdapter
extends Object
implements GridMetadataAware, Cloneable

Convenient adapter for GridMetadataAware.

Thread Safety

This class provides necessary synchronization for thread-safe access.

hasMeta

public <V> boolean hasMeta(String name,
                           V val)
Tests whether or not metadata with given name and value is set. Returns true if attachment with given name it set and its value is equals to provided value. Otherwise returns false.

Specified by:
hasMeta in interface GridMetadataAware
Type Parameters:
V - Type of the value.
Parameters:
name - Name of the metadata.
val - Value to compare. Cannot be null.
Returns:
true if metadata with given name is set and its value is equals to provided value - otherwise returns false.

putMetaIfAbsent

@Nullable
public <V> V putMetaIfAbsent(String name,
                                      V val)
Adds given metadata value only if it was absent.

Specified by:
putMetaIfAbsent in interface GridMetadataAware
Type Parameters:
V - Type of the value.
Parameters:
name - Metadata name.
val - Value to add if it's not attached already.
Returns:
null if new value was put, or current value if put didn't happen.

putMetaIfAbsent

@Nullable
public <V> V putMetaIfAbsent(String name,
                                      Callable<V> c)
Adds given metadata value only if it was absent.

Specified by:
putMetaIfAbsent in interface GridMetadataAware
Type Parameters:
V - Type of the value.
Parameters:
name - Metadata name.
c - Factory closure to produce value to add if it's not attached already. Not that unlike GridMetadataAware.addMeta(String, Object) method the factory closure will not be called unless the value is required and therefore value will only be created when it is actually needed.
Returns:
null if new value was put, or current value if put didn't happen.

addMetaIfAbsent

public <V> V addMetaIfAbsent(String name,
                             V val)
Adds given metadata value only if it was absent. Unlike GridMetadataAware.putMetaIfAbsent(String, Callable), this method always returns the latest value and never previous one.

Specified by:
addMetaIfAbsent in interface GridMetadataAware
Type Parameters:
V - Type of the value.
Parameters:
name - Metadata name.
val - Value to add if it's not attached already.
Returns:
The value of the metadata after execution of this method.

addMetaIfAbsent

@Nullable
public <V> V addMetaIfAbsent(String name,
                                      @Nullable
                                      Callable<V> c)
Adds given metadata value only if it was absent.

Specified by:
addMetaIfAbsent in interface GridMetadataAware
Type Parameters:
V - Type of the value.
Parameters:
name - Metadata name.
c - Factory closure to produce value to add if it's not attached already. Not that unlike GridMetadataAware.addMeta(String, Object) method the factory closure will not be called unless the value is required and therefore value will only be created when it is actually needed. If null and metadata value is missing - null will be returned from this method.
Returns:
The value of the metadata after execution of this method.

replaceMeta

public <V> boolean replaceMeta(String name,
                               V curVal,
                               V newVal)
Replaces given metadata with new newVal value only if its current value is equal to curVal. Otherwise, it is no-op.

Specified by:
replaceMeta in interface GridMetadataAware
Parameters:
name - Name of the metadata.
curVal - Current value to check.
newVal - New value.
Returns:
true if replacement occurred, false otherwise.

writeExternalMeta

protected void writeExternalMeta(ObjectOutput out)
                          throws IOException
Convenience way for super-classes which implement Externalizable to serialize metadata. Super-classes must call this method explicitly from within Externalizable.writeExternal(ObjectOutput) methods implementation.

Throws:
IOException - If I/O error occurred.
Parameters:
out - Output to write to.

readExternalMeta

protected void readExternalMeta(ObjectInput in)
                         throws IOException,
                                ClassNotFoundException
Convenience way for super-classes which implement Externalizable to serialize metadata. Super-classes must call this method explicitly from within Externalizable.readExternal(ObjectInput) methods implementation.

Throws:
IOException - If I/O error occurred.
ClassNotFoundException - If some class could not be found.
Parameters:
in - Input to read from.
